title: Fresh Tomato Galette
subtitle: Savory tart with ripe tomatoes and a flaky, buttery crust
description: A rustic tomato galette with Gruyère cheese, Dijon mustard, and a flaky homemade crust, designed to avoid sogginess from juicy tomatoes.
author: Alli Berkey

ingredients.name: Unsalted butter
ingredients.quantity: 10 tbsp, chilled and cut into ½-inch pieces

ingredients.name: Mixed tomatoes, sliced ¼ inch thick

instructions: Process flour and ½ tsp salt in food processor until combined. Add butter and pulse until coarse crumbs form. Transfer to bowl.
Sprinkle with 6 tbsp ice water and stir until dough forms, adding up to 1 tbsp more if needed. Shape into 4-inch disk, wrap, and chill for 1 hour.
Toss tomatoes with 1 tsp salt in a bowl. Transfer to colander and drain for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375°F. Roll dough into a 12-inch circle on a floured surface and transfer to a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Combine tomatoes, shallot, oil, thyme, garlic, pepper, and remaining salt. Spread mustard over dough, sprinkle Gruyère, then layer tomatoes. Sprinkle Parmesan.
Fold dough edge over filling, pleating as needed. Brush crust with egg.
Bake until golden brown and bubbling, 45–50 minutes. Cool 10 minutes, then transfer and cool another 20 minutes.
Sprinkle with basil, slice, and serve warm.
